dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: a lot of people think that botnets are just annoying spam machines, but the reality is, they're way more dangerous than that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: a lot of people think that botnets are just annoying spam machines, but the reality is, they're way more dangerous than that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. I mean, take Trickbot— nearly 100,000 hijacked computers under one network. That's not just spam, it's infrastructure for serious attacks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. I mean, take Trickbot- nearly one hundred thousand hijacked computers under one network. That's not just spam, it's infrastructure for serious attacks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Trickbot botnet is a network of nearly 1 million hijacked computers run by Russian-speaking criminals that Microsoft referred to as the worlds most prolific distributors of ransomware.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Microsoft just got a court order to try and shut it down. They're working with telecoms worldwide to disrupt those servers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Microsoft just got a court order to try and shut it down. They're working with telecoms worldwide to disrupt those servers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Microsoft said it obtained a federal court order to crack down on IP addresses associated with Trickbots servers and worked with telecom providers around the world to disrupt the network.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is huge, 'cause this isn't just some random malware— it's ransomware. Hackers lock up data and demand payment, or they'll leak it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is huge, 'cause this isn't just some random malware- it's ransomware. Hackers lock up data and demand payment, or they'll leak it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ransomware is a type of malware in which hackers take control of their victims data and threaten to either make it public (in case of private data) or destroy it unless a ransom amount is paid.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the scary part? They could target election systems. Imagine voter registration databases or results reporting getting hit right on Election Day.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the scary part? They could target election systems. Imagine voter registration databases or results reporting getting hit right on Election Day.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Microsoft stated that adversaries may be able to use ransomware to infect computers used to store voter rolls or report election night results, leading to chaos at polling stations on Election Day.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, chaos at the polls. And it's not just private groups— even U.S. Cyber Command has been trying to permanently dismantle Trickbot.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, chaos at the polls. And it's not just private groups- even U.S. Cyber Command has been trying to permanently dismantle Trickbot.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During the weekend, the Washington Post reported that the U.S. Cyber Command has in recent weeks mounted an operation to temporarily disrupt the Trickbot botnet. The report noted that while the action may not permanently dismantle the network, it may distract them for a while as they seek to restore operations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. But here's the thing— is Microsoft's action separate from what Cyber Command's doing, or are they working together? The article says it's unclear.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. But here's the thing- is Microsoft's action separate from what Cyber Command's doing, or are they working together? The article says it's unclear.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is unclear if Microsofts actions announced on Monday are separate from the Cyber Commands operation or a part of it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just one threat actor either. We've got Russia, Iran... and China, too. Remember SKDKnickerbocker? Trump's campaign firm?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just one threat actor either. We've got Russia, Iran... and China, too. Remember SKDKnickerbocker? Trump's campaign firm?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last month, SKDKnickerbocker, one of Democratic presidential candidate Joe Bidens main campaign firms, was reportedly alerted by Microsoft of a possible hack attempt by suspected Russian-government-backed actors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah— Google warned them about a suspected Chinese-state hack attempt last month. Their network was poorly defended, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah- Google warned them about a suspected Chinese-state hack attempt last month. Their network was poorly defended, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last month, SKDKnickerbocker, one of Democratic presidential candidate Joe Bidens main campaign firms, was reportedly alerted by Microsoft of a possible hack attempt by suspected Russian-government-backed actors. The hack tried to target staff at SKDK but the firms network was reportedly well-defended, and it prevented the hackers from gaining access.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which lines up with what Mueller warned about back in 2019— China's likely to interfere again this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which lines up with what Mueller warned about back in twenty nineteen- China's likely to interfere again this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2019, Mueller warned that Russia is likely to interfere again in 2020.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So we're looking at a multi-front digital war here, and these botnets are like the artillery.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So we're looking at a multi-front digital war here, and these botnets are like the artillery.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Disrupting one, even a big one like Trickbot, is just one battle. The war on election security is far from over.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Disrupting one, even a big one like Trickbot, is just one battle. The war on election security is far from over.
